candidate_text: According to various sources, (including the Ministry of Energy and Industry in Qatar), the price of natural gas for consumers in Qatar is subsidized by the government.
In Qatar, as of 2022, to provide subsidized rates to its citizens and residents, the government fixes prices for natural gas and other utilities.
The cost of natural gas for Qatari citizens is QR 0.10 per therm (approximately USD 0.0275), which is heavily subsidized by the government.

For residential consumers in Qatar, the price of natural gas is:

* QR 0.60 per therm (approximately USD 0.165) for the first 300 therms per month.

As per the regulations set by the Qatari government, 

the cost of natural gas for residential consumers in Qatar is approximately QAR 0.60 (Qatari Riyal) per therm (approximately 29.3 megajoules or 27.83 cubic meters).
The retail price of natural gas for Qatari citizens is QR 0.60 (approximately USD 0.165) per therm (1 therm = 100,000 British Thermal Units or BTU).

For Qatari nationals:

* The cost of natural gas is QR 0.15 (approximately USD 0.041) per therm (29.3 kilowatt-hours).
